title: The Robot Apocalypse Edition
description:
On this episode of Slate Money, hosts Felix Salmon of Fusion, Cathy O’Neil, author of the upcoming, Weapons of Math Destruction, and Ryan Avent, author of The Wealth of Humans: Work, Power, and Status in the Twenty-first Century discuss how jobs are changing in the robot economy, Wells Fargo’s unnecessary banking products, and shifty Amazon pricing algorithms.
Topics discussed on today’s show include:
-Ryan Avent discusses his take on how work might change in the future, a topic explored in his book The Wealth of Humans: Work, Power, and Status in the Twenty-first Century
-The pressure Wells Fargo put on bank tellers to sign customers up for products they weren’t interested in
-Bias in Amazon’s pricing algorithm
Check out other Panoply podcasts at itunes.com/panoply.
Email: slatemoney@slate.com
Twitter: @felixsalmon, @mathbabedotorg, @JHWeissmann
Production by Mickey Capper.
